meanings.definition: To reject or disallow a decision or ruling made by someone in authority.
meanings.sent1: The judge overruled the objection raised by the lawyer.
meanings.sent2: The higher court overruled the lower court's decision.
meanings.sent3: The cat overruled the dog's choice of napping spot.
meanings.sent4: Laughter overruled the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sun overruled the clouds, shining brightly.

meanings.definition: To have more power or authority than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: In the game of chess, the queen overruled all other pieces.
meanings.sent2: The CEO's decision overruled the manager's suggestion.
meanings.sent3: The loud music overruled the sound of the rain outside.
meanings.sent4: Her determination overruled any doubts she had.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's instructions overruled any student objections.

meanings.definition: To prevail over or supersede something else.
meanings.sent1: The new law overruled the old regulations.
meanings.sent2: His enthusiasm overruled any hesitations he had.
meanings.sent3: The aroma of freshly baked cookies overruled all other scents in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song overruled the background noise.
meanings.sent5: The team's unity overruled individual differences.
